channel.title: Connecting to a server with my client
channel.description:
Hello Moparscape. I'm currently developing a Cheat Client. I understand that people would rather use reflection clients, mostly because of compatibility, which is actually my issue. I prefer not to use reflection clients, because now a days most big servers have obfsucated clients, and I believe reflecting an obfuscated client is a lot more work than just finding the UID.
Anyways, I found a pretty big server that I wanted to test my cheat client on, so I decompiled the client and got the UID. The UID was correct, but when I logged in, I was stuck in this frame:
[img]http://i.imgur.com/xxBvz.png[/img]
My screen is stuck like this virtually forever. No errors print out, telling me that it's not the sendCrashFrame method.
The client I'm using is standard InsidiaX, and the server I'm connecting to seems to be InsidiaX based as well, with a few extra customs. I'm not sure if this is a cache problem, or if it's some sort of server-sided check that I'm not aware of.
Anyone have an idea on how to bypass it?

item.title: Connecting to a server with my client
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“Native^, post:9, topic:454284”][quote author=Skorge link=topic=557152.msg4077724#msg4077724 date=1345017786]

lol @ uid not serving its intended purpose.

In my honest opinion, the most effective way of preventing cheat clients is efficient server-sided code.
UIDs, client obfuscation, spaghetti code, etc. will merely make it harder.
[/quote]
why? i mean, the uid is stored as a file. you can just read that file and voila, you’ve the uid. no offense by the way[/quote]
so easy.

>‘ï
read it with no program at all.

Read full topic
item.source: Connecting to a server with my client

item.description:
@Skorge wrote:

[quote=“Native^, post:9, topic:454284”][quote author=Skorge link=topic=557152.msg4077724#msg4077724 date=1345017786]

lol @ uid not serving its intended purpose.

In my honest opinion, the most effective way of preventing cheat clients is efficient server-sided code.
UIDs, client obfuscation, spaghetti code, etc. will merely make it harder.
[/quote]
why? i mean, the uid is stored as a file. you can just read that file and voila, you’ve the uid. no offense by the way[/quote]

Read the original post, I already got the UID, and it is valid. I never said I had any trouble finding the server’s UID.

Read full topic

item.title: Connecting to a server with my client
item.dc:creator: @Skorge Skorge
item.description:
@Skorge wrote:

Native^:

Sorry but could you explain to me why you would need the uid??

So I can connect to their server with my client.

Read full topic

item.title: Connecting to a server with my client
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“Skorge, post:3, topic:454284”][quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=557152.msg4077351#msg4077351 date=1344976783]
Copy their client’s login protocol. Sometimes they add extra data to send to the server for more checks.
[/quote]

Thanks for the help! The client’s obfuscated, so it will be pretty time consuming, I’ll give an update when I’m finished.[/quote]Couldn’t look at the picture, but now that I can I noticed that it’s not the protocol. There might be more checks when each player gets initialised.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Skorge wrote:

imsuperman05:

Copy their client’s login protocol. Sometimes they add extra data to send to the server for more checks.

Thanks for the help! The client’s obfuscated, so it will be pretty time consuming, I’ll give an update when I’m finished.

Read full topic
